example.eg: Audrey threw the ball at the ground, and it bounced.  A basketball bounced across the courtyard.
example.egtrans: 奥德丽把球掷在地上，球反弹了起来。一颗篮球弹过了院子。

example.eg: The children were bouncing around the room after eating so much candy.
example.egtrans: 孩子们吃了很多糖果，在房子里蹦蹦跳跳。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 蹦蹦跳跳, 蹦来蹦去

example.eg: The little girl was bouncing a ball as she walked along the street.
example.egtrans: 小姑娘在街上一边走，一边拍球。

example.eg: Catherine bounced the basketball off the side of the building.
example.egtrans: 凯瑟琳在楼边墙上来回弹着篮球。

example.eg: The squash ball hit the wall and bounced off.
example.egtrans: 壁球击中墙面，弹了回来。

example.eg: The ball bounced off the wall.
With a bounce, the rabbit darted across the road.
example.egtrans: 一个弹跳，兔子迅速跃过了道路。

example.eg: This tennis ball has lost its bounce.
Rob appears to have his bounce back after his recent illness.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 活力, 精力, 生气
无礼, 冒失, 鲁莽

example.eg: Leo's boss gave him the bounce because he was always late to work.
example.egtrans: 由于里奥老是上班迟到，所以老板开除了他。

dsense.name: bounce⇒
dsense.guideword: figurative, informal (cheque: be rejected by bank)

example.eg: The cheque bounced as he had insufficient funds in his account.
example.egtrans: 因为他账户里的钱不够了，所以支票被拒付退回。

example.eg: The glare of headlights bounced off of the shop window.
example.egtrans: 头灯的亮光反射在商店橱窗上。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 从...反射回来, 反射在...上

example.eg: The bank bounced my check because there wasn't enough money in the account.
example.egtrans: 由于账上的资金不够了，银行拒付并退回了我的支票。

example.eg: The football players were bounced from the club for starting a fight.
example.egtrans: 由于打架斗殴，那些足球运动员被驱逐出了俱乐部。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 将…从…驱逐出去, 将…逐出…

example.eg: I'll bounce the idea off my boss and get back to you.
example.egtrans: 我将去征求老板的意见，然后再回来找你。

example.eg: He was dangerously ill at one point but he bounced back quickly.
example.egtrans: 他之前还病得很重，但是很快就康复了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 迅速康复，恢复健康，恢复信心

example.eg: The company will bounce back from financial instability because its products are in demand.
example.egtrans: 这家公司将从不稳定的财务状况中恢复过来，因为旗下产品仍销路很好。

example.eg: My e-mail bounced back to me because I mistyped your address.
example.egtrans: 我的电子邮件被退回，因为我将你的邮箱地址打错了。

example.eg: It's set to be a bounce-back season for the team after their poor performance last year.

dsense.name: dead cat bounce
dsense.guideword: figurative (stock market: brief recovery) (股市：短暂复苏)
